Which of the following drugs acts at the site labeled "D" in the diagram?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Other Options: A. Entacapone → Incorrect. Acts only in the periphery (site B), not in the brain. Does not affect central COMT. B. Selegiline → Incorrect. This is a MAO-B inhibitor, which acts at site C, not D. D. Benserazide → Incorrect. This is a DOPA decarboxylase inhibitor that acts in the periphery (site A), preventing conversion of levodopa to dopamine outside the brain.

questions.text: A patient recovering from a traumatic injury to the face now finds himself unable to chew his food. On physical examination, his jaw deviates to the right side. The nerve that has been injured in this patient exits the skull through which of the following foramina?
During which of the following phase the cell will be most radiosensitive?
Which of the following drugs are known to potentially cause or worsen mental depression? A. Zuranolone B. Isotretinoin C. Interferon-alpha D. Corticosteroids E. Montelukast
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • C. Interferon-alpha • Used in chronic hepatitis B/C and certain cancers. • Frequently causes major depression, fatigue, and cognitive impairment due to pro-inflammatory cytokine effects on the brain.
  • • D. Corticosteroids • High-dose or prolonged use can cause mood disturbances, including depression, anxiety, and even steroid-induced psychosis. • Mechanism involves altered HPA axis and neurotransmitter changes.
  • • E. Montelukast • A leukotriene receptor antagonist used in asthma and allergic rhinitis. • Has a black box warning for neuropsychiatric effects, including depression, agitation, suicidal thoughts, especially in children and adolescents.
  • • A. Zuranolone • This is a positive allosteric modulator of GABA-A receptors, recently approved for postpartum depression. • It is actually used to treat depression, not cause it.

  • • TFR < Replacement level: Population decreases
  • • TFR = Replacement level: Population is stable
  • • TFR > Replacement level: Population increases

questions.text: A 26-year-old male presents with painful swelling of the right knee, lower back stiffness, and painful urination for the past two weeks. He also reports redness and irritation in both eyes. He had a recent episode of diarrhea 4 weeks ago after eating street food. On examination, he has tenderness over the Achilles tendon and a keratoderma blennorrhagicum lesion on the sole. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • This patient has classic features of Reactive Arthritis (Reiter's syndrome):
  • • • Triad: Arthritis, urethritis, and conjunctivitis (or uveitis)
  • • • History of preceding GI infection (e.g., Shigella, Salmonella, Campylobacter)
  • • • Enthesitis (Achilles tendon pain)
  • • • Skin lesion: Keratoderma blennorrhagicum is characteristic
  • • • Typically affects young males, and often HLA-B27 positive

A patient comes with a severe pain in left flank and fever. His urine output of last 24 hours was 400 ml. Blood examination showed TLC count of 12,000/ cmm and Urea 55 mg%. USG showed dilated left sided hydroureteronephrosis and non visualized right kidney. Left kidney was dilated with turbid fluid collection. Lower ureter could not be visualized. A diagnosis of solitary Kidney, left ureteric stone with pyonephrosis was made. What should be next step.

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate ureteroscopy and removal of stone

options.label: D
options.text: High grade antibiotics, fluid challenge and diuresis

questions.text: The problem of gossypiboma (textiloma) is mainly due the negligence in which phase of WHO safety checklist list?

The police bring a 22-year-old white male to the emergency department. From the outset, he is belligerent, aggressive, and violent, requiring the efforts of several officers to restrain him. When questioned, the patient is paranoid. Physical exam shows him to have muscle rigidity and pupils that move up and down rapidly. The patient had previously been treated for opiate overdose. What neurochemical mechanisms are most likely to account for the patient's current behavior?

options.label: C
options.text: Partial agonist of the postsynaptic serotonin receptors

options.label: D
options.text: Antagonism of the locus cerelose pathway and blocking of substance P

questions.correct_answer: B. Antagonism of the glutamate receptors

A patient of blunt abdominal grade III injury was being treated on conservative line. On 6th day he showed sign of deterioration with tachycardia, fall in BP and pain in left upper abdomen. His Hb has fallen from 14 Gm% to 12.5Gm%. His Urine out and ABG is within normal limit. CECT showed a splenic blush. What should be done next?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood transfusion and monitor for next 24 hors

questions.text: A known alcoholic is brought to the emergency department by his wife. The person has not consumed alcohol for the past two days due to religious reasons. Which of the following would be the best medication to manage the seizures of the patient?

A 55 year old man presented with right flank pain and 2 episodes of hematuria. He is recently diagnosed hypertensive and his Hb is 17.4 gm%, KFT and LFT were normal. CT scan showed a 4 * 3 cm lesion at the lower pole of right kidney. What is the ideal treatment for this patient?
Which of the following is NOT true about Pott's Spine?

options.label: A
options.text: First sign in Pott's Paraplegia is Ankle Clonus

options.label: B
options.text: First part to be involved is Vertebral Body

options.label: C
options.text: First Xray Sign is blurring of Paradiscal Margins

options.label: D
options.text: Sphincter involvement is a late sign

questions.correct_answer: C. First Xray Sign is blurring of Paradiscal Margins

options.label: A
options.text: Decreases the risk of endometrial hyperplasia and cancer

options.label: B
options.text: Does not increase the risk of breast cancer

options.label: C
options.text: Reduces the risk of venous thrombosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Reduces the risk of venous thrombosis

questions.text: A 72 years old female has carcinoma of cervix with postmenopausal bleeding. On clinical examination, it was found that left parametrium was involved. Intravenous pyelogram revealed hydronephrosis on the left side due to ureteric obstruction. What is the stage of this cancer?
Delta F508 mutation has a functional defect on the CFTR channel. It leads to

options.label: B
options.text: Defect in protein trafficking with ubiquitination and degradation in endoplasmic reticulum/Golgi body

options.label: C
options.text: Defective regulation; CFTR not activated by adenosine triphosphate or cyclic adenosine monophosphate

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced chloride transport through CFTR at the apical membrane

questions.correct_answer: B. Defect in protein trafficking with ubiquitination and degradation in endoplasmic reticulum/Golgi body

questions.text: Which one of the following statements is true about LH-peak in the physiology of menstrual cycle?
questions.correct_answer: D. It occurs 12 hours before ovulation

A patient who was diagnosed with prostate cancer is being investigated. The bone scan is reported as a super scan with increased uptake in the bones and reduced activity in the kidney and soft tissue. What is the reason for this super scan appearance?

options.label: B
options.text: Increased uptake due to diffuse metastasis

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased uptake by adrenal glands and kidney

questions.correct_answer: B. Increased uptake due to diffuse metastasis

A 15-year-old male adolescent is undergoing a sports preparticipation evaluation in order to participate in competitive baseball. He has no notable medical history and is not currently on any medications. There is no family history of kidney disease. The boy's weight is at the 75th percentile, while his height is at the 90th percentile for his age group. His blood pressure reading is 110/70 mm Hg. The rest of his physical examination results are within normal limits. A urine sample was submitted to the laboratory for further analysis following a positive dipstick test for protein conducted in the office. The results of urine testing are shown: Of the following, the BEST next step in management of this adolescent is to

options.label: A
options.text: Order a 24-hour urine protein excretion test

options.label: B
options.text: Order a first morning urine protein:creatinine ratio

questions.correct_answer: B. Order a first morning urine protein:creatinine ratio

questions.text: Which one of the following is not the indication of MgSO4 therapy in obstetrics?

This is about a 12 yr old boy. His problems typically started in early adolescence with jerks in the morning, often causing to drop things; generalized tonic–clonic or clonic–tonic–clonic seizures upon awakening. Sleep deprivation and photic stimulation acted like precipitants. Following is his EEG. What is your diagnosis?
A 27 years old primigravida has presence of cervical ectopic pregnancy. Which one of the following is not a feature of this pregnancy?
A 27 years old nulliparous patient has endometriotic cyst of 8-cm size in left ovary. She has dysmenorrhoea as well as dyspareunia. The appropriate management in this case is?

A 13 mo old previously healthy child presents on New Year's Eve with a 2-day history of fever, lethargy, and irritability. Earlier this afternoon he began to have twitching movements of his left arm and on the left side of his face. His immunizations are up-to-date. Physical examination reveals fever with a temperature of 39°C and left-sided weakness, with no rashes. Examination of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) reveals 70 WBCs/mm 3 with 85% lymphocytes, 400 RBCs/mm3, protein of 140 mg/dL, glucose 80 mg/dL, and negative results on Gram stain. MRI reveals right temporal abnormalities. The diagnostic study most likely to identify a treatable illness in a timely fashion is:

options.label: B
options.text: Herpes simplex virus polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assay

options.label: D
options.text: Comparison of maternal and infant antibody titers

questions.correct_answer: B. Herpes simplex virus polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assay

questions.text: A young lady presents to your office with complain of copious vaginal discharge, but there is no cervical discharge on per speculum examination. Which of the following should be given for the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Group B Streptococcal screening------ 28 to 32 weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. Dual marker test---- 11 to 13 + 6 weeks

The child has not experienced any fractures. His diet is well-balanced, consisting of table foods and cow's milk. The adoptive parents have limited information regarding his biological family, except that the biological mother is notably short in stature. The physical examination reveals only significant bowing of both legs. A radiograph of the right knee indicates the presence of osteopenia, along with widened and frayed metaphyses. Laboratory data are shown: Of the following, the MOST likely cause of this boy’s findings is

options.label: A
options.text: Face presentation with mento posterior position

questions.correct_answer: B. Breech presentation with entrapped head
